verses.roman:
vidūrathas tu tad-bhrātā
bhrātṛ-śoka-pariplutaḥ
āgacchad asi-carmābhyām
ucchvasaṁs taj-jighāṁsayā

synonyms: vidūrathaḥ—Vidūratha; tu—but; tat—his, Dantavakra's; bhrātā—brother; bhrātṛ—for his brother; śoka—in sorrow; pariplutaḥ—submerged; āgacchat—came forward; asi—with sword; carmābhyām—and shield; ucchvasan—breathing heavily; tat—Him, Lord Kṛṣṇa; jighāṁsayā—wanting to kill.
translation: But then Dantavakra's brother Vidūratha, immersed in sorrow over his brother's death, came forward breathing heavily, sword and shield in hand. He wanted to kill the Lord.
